page.title: 18A Hall Green Inhabitant
page.content: Alison Ross and Trudi Ward went to visit Mrs Cusworth, about how she used to live. Mrs Cusworth is an elderly widow. She was in a bad physical condition, she couldn't speak all that well and she kept on coughing. she had a serious chest complaint called Brochial asthma. Her second husband had been dead twenty two years but she didn't mind talking about him as she had had a happy marriage. This is what Mrs Cusworth said,"I've lived in Hall Green since i was ten months old. I was born in 1909 and my earliest memorys of hall green are that everywhere was fields and there was a big country house called Tanners Arms and there was a farm where the co_op is. The first school I went to was Painthorpe first school and it makes me sad to see that its been knocked down.
